title: Death at the Ashcombe Gala
description: Reginald Ashcombe, patriarch and philanthropist, is found dead at the bottom of his grand staircase following his annual charity gala. The constable calls it an accident. But his widow suspects murder. Question suspects, examine evidence, and uncover the truth behind the fall.

suspects.name: Veronica Ashcombe
suspects.bio: 62 years old, graceful and intelligent. Once a concert pianist, now manages the social and charitable side of Ashcombe Estate. Found Reginald's body at the bottom of the grand staircase.

suspects.name: Martin Ashcombe
suspects.bio: 61 years old, Reginald's younger brother. Charming but financially dependent. Former academic who squandered opportunities through gambling. Was very drunk during the gala.

suspects.name: Colin Dorsey
suspects.bio: 53 years old, Reginald's right hand and estate manager. Competent and loyal on the surface. Responded to Veronica's scream after the body was discovered.

suspects.name: Lydia Portwell
suspects.bio: 51 years old, polished and ambitious. Oversees the Ashcombe Foundation's fundraising campaigns. Was helping Veronica rehearse her speech when the murder occurred.

suspects.name: Dr. Leonard Vale
suspects.bio: 58 years old, elegant and calculating. Longtime friend of the Ashcombe family and attending physician. Left the ballroom early for an 'urgent phone call' before Reginald's death.

locations.name: Grand Staircase (Private Wing)
locations.description: The crime scene. Reginald's body was found at the bottom of these marble stairs. A wine glass lay nearby, its dark contents spilled across the floor in a tight cluster.

locations.name: Grand Conservatory (Greenhouse)
locations.description: Reginald's pride and joy - a glass-domed greenhouse filled with rare orchids and tropical blooms. He personally led tours here during the afternoon.

locations.name: Lawn & Terrace
locations.description: Where the afternoon luncheon was held. White canopies, champagne, and society's polished conversation filled the space earlier that day.

locations.name: Ballroom
locations.description: The grand ballroom where the evening's charity presentation took place. Crystal chandeliers, live music, and dozens of guests filled the space.

locations.name: Master Bedroom (Private Wing)
locations.description: Veronica and Reginald's private quarters. Elegant and intimate, with a grand portrait on the wall and a piano bench where Veronica keeps sheet music.

locations.name: Reginald's Study
locations.description: Reginald's private office. A place of business and secrets. The study contains a safe where Reginald kept his most sensitive documents.

records.name: Coroner's Report
records.description: Official autopsy and scene analysis. Rules the death as accidental.
records.content:
CAUSE OF DEATH: Fatal skull fracture

FINDINGS: Injury pattern consistent with fall from TOP of staircase. Single point of impact. No secondary bruising or defensive wounds.

TOXICOLOGY: Alcohol present, within social drinking range.

RULING: Accidental fall. No evidence of foul play.

records.name: Crime Scene Photographs
records.description: Photos taken at the scene, including close-ups of the body, wine spill, and staircase.

records.name: Gala Event Photos
records.description: Photos from the evening's festivities, showing guests, staff, and the inner circle throughout the event.

records.name: Blackmail Papers (Found at Scene)
records.description: Documents found scattered near Reginald's body, collected by Veronica. Contains incriminating evidence on Martin, Lydia, and Colin - but Dr. Vale's page is missing.

records.name: Blackmail Papers (Behind Portrait)
records.description: The complete original set of blackmail documents hidden behind a portrait in the master bedroom. Includes ALL pages, including Dr. Vale's.

records.name: Phone Records
records.description: Estate phone logs from the evening of the gala, showing all incoming and outgoing calls.

records.name: Greenhouse Security Footage
records.description: Automatically uploaded security camera footage from the greenhouse, timestamped during the gala.
